newsitem.title: CANADA: Saskatchewan harvests 16 pct of crop vs 20 pct avg.
newsitem.headline: Saskatchewan harvests 16 pct of crop vs 20 pct avg.

text.p: Saskatchewan farmers harvested 16 percent of their crops compared with 20 percent at this time for the five-year average in the week ended September 4, Saskatchewan Agriculture said in its report.

Nineteen percent of barley, 17 percent of durum wheat, 13 percent of canola and 12 percent of spring wheat were combined. Preliminary wheat quality estimates suggested an above-average quality wheat crop with 90 percent of the harvested crop grading number one.
Southern Saskatchewan saw less than one mm of rain, 19 percent of spring wheat was harvested, 96 percent graded No1.
Central Saskatchewan saw an average of less than one mm of rain, nine percent of spring wheat was harvested, 89 percent graded No1, 10 percent No2 and one percent No3.
Northern Saskatchewan saw less than one mm of rain, six percent of spring wheat was harvested, 82 percent graded No1, 14 percent No2 and three percent No3 with one percent grading as feed wheat.
